channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024050016
item.description:
Report X-2024050016

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible wet conditions and torn. Upon inspection 4 bottles were discovered of which 2 had no visible damage and the other 2 had some internal leakage. Out of the 2 that leaked out 1 had only about a cup left of solution in the bottle, the other one had only spilled about 2 cups and had majority of the solution. Both bottles had loose caps causing the spillage. The package failure was due to the bottles having loose caps and seals causing internal leakage during the unloading phase. I recommend for better closures for the plastic bottles.

item.title: Report X-2024050042
item.description:
Report X-2024050042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible wet conditions. Upon inspection, 1 of 4 plastic bottles was found with a loose cap. Bottle leaked out about 1/2 cup or less of solution from one of the part b bottles. Package failure was due to the bottle having a loose cap and movement during the unloading process caused the solution to leak out. Outer packaging was wet and ripped/ torn damaging tracking label. Op900 was intact. Package was placed into a salvage drum to await disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024050036
item.description:
Report X-2024050036

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-28
  • City: KEASBEY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024050036 attachment Name:image0 (13).jpeg 2. X-2024050037 attachment Name:Hazmat- Damaged Haz Mat Package Disposition 04302024.pdf 3. X-2024050038 DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVE AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION TWO BOTTLES OF RAPICIDE PART B WAS FOUND TO BE HALF WAY LEAKED OUT AND THE CAPS MISSING. THE CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE.

item.title: Report X-2024050005
item.description:
Report X-2024050005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-24
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: After inspection was done and signs of post leakage was discovered, due to lose cap on one of the plastic bottles. Cap was tightened and contents were placed in a lined salvaged drum. Inner seal on bottle may help with future spillage. Even more inner packaging and stronger fiberboard box may help to avoid future damages.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-26
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SHIPMENT WAS LEFT IN DAMAGE AREA AND NO COMMUNICATION WAS PROVIDED. UPON INSPECTION INNER CONTENTS PRROCK CHEMICAL UN2880 PRODUCT NAME: AQUA-RG PLUS IN A PLASTIC PAIL 26.250 KG THAT HAD A CRACK AT THE BOTTOM THAT CAUSED SPILLAGE. ARE FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible signs of leakage. Upon inspection, 1 of 4 plastic bottles was found with a loose cap causing about 1/2 cup of solution to leak out and soil the outer packaging. Box and label soiled due to leakage. Contents were immediately placed into a salvage drum to await disposition. package failure was due to a loose cap causing solution to leak out during shipping phase.

item.title: Report X-2024041380
item.description:
Report X-2024041380

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-23
  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered damages at 11:30pm during the outbound sort. Smart portion of the contents leak on to the packaging and out the box onto the floor. After inspecting the type of hazmat we found that the liquid is Xylene a substance primarily used as a solvent. Local clean up was applied. The content container is glass when ultimately cracked and broke during Outbound 2 sort. The package was located in load 3 by safety specialist Brandon L. Burke.

item.title: Report X-2024041365
item.description:
Report X-2024041365

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T15:11:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During he day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with visible wet conditions and box torn. Upon inspection, 1 bottle was found inside the box in a plastic bag. Bottle was soiled due to leakage from the bottle and being trapped in the plastic bag. Bottle contained "BONDERITE C-IC 33 AERO" and leaked out about 1/3 of the liquid solution. Package failure seems to be caused by being dropped causing solution to leak out.

item.title: Report I-2024100036
item.description:
Report I-2024100036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-01T00:36:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: FAIRVIEW
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: WASTE MANAGEMENT OF NEW JERSEY, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On December 5, 2023, a Waste Management of New Jersey, Inc. truck inadvertently transported a container that contained several boxes with containers of plastic hand sanitizer bottles to the Waste Management of New Jersey, Inc. Fairview Solid Waste Facility Transfer Station / Material Recovery Facility in Fairview, NJ. The origin location of the hand sanitizer is Pocas International, 19 Central Blvd, South Hackensack, NJ. The container was tipped onto the solid waste transfer station tip floor and upon discovery, the WMNJI Fairview Transfer Station personnel shut down the tipping floor to secure the area. The New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection was notified and NJDEP incident ID# 23-12-05-1711-50 was assigned. The material was then re-packaged by a third party company (Whitman) into the appropriate containers, labeled, secured in a safe area at the facility for ultimate transportation to the appropriate facility for recycling or disposal.
